org.knime.core.node.exec

Class SandboxedNodeCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.exec.SandboxedNodeCreator

  • public final class SandboxedNodeCreator
extends Object
    Helper to create a small workflow that runs a copy of a node in isolation. Needed for (remote) node execution jobs, whereby the target node is first copied into a sandbox before it's run. Input data is populated by fake nodes of type PortObjectInNodeFactory.
    Since:
    3.1
    Author:
    Bernd Wiswedel, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  SandboxedNodeCreator.SandboxedNode
      An instance wrapping a sandboxed node container.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SandboxedNodeCreator

        public SandboxedNodeCreator(NodeContainer ncToClone,
                            PortObject[] inData,
                            WorkflowManager rootWFM)
        New creator with base information that can be further customized using the setter methods. None of the arguments must be null.
        Parameters:
        ncToClone - The node to clone.
        inData - The input data the node is provided with. Length must correspond to number of inputs.
        rootWFM - the parent workflow into which the new temporary project is created. The cluster execution and streamer executor have their own private pool to not pollute WFM#ROOT.

    • Method Detail

      • setLocalWorkflowDir

        public SandboxedNodeCreator setLocalWorkflowDir(File localWorkflowDir)
        Where to save the sandboxed workflow after it's created. For the cluster execution this is a 'real' folder. Default is null -- so a temporary workflow folder is assigned and the workflow is not saved to disc after it's been created.
        Parameters:
        localWorkflowDir - The folder or null (which is the default).
        Returns:
        this (method chaining)

      • setCopyData

        public SandboxedNodeCreator setCopyData(boolean copyDataIntoNewContext)
        Set whether to copy the data from the original workflow into the sandboxed workflow. This is true if the workflow is run some place else (in the cluster) so that data including filestores and blobs make a context switch. This is expensive (I/O) but needed to guarantee isolation. Default is false -- so the temporary workflow is using the data directly associated with the original workflow.
        Parameters:
        copyDataIntoNewContext - that property (default is false).
        Returns:
        this (method chaining).

      • setForwardConnectionProgressEvents

        public SandboxedNodeCreator setForwardConnectionProgressEvents(boolean forwardConnectionProgressEvents)
        Whether to forward progress events on ConnectionContainer. This is true for the streaming executor but false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        forwardConnectionProgressEvents - that property (default is false).
        Returns:
        this (method chaining).

      • isDeleteOnDiscard

        boolean isDeleteOnDiscard()
        Callback from SandboxedNodeCreator.SandboxedNode instance whether to delete the folder after the workflow is disposed.

      • createSandbox

        public SandboxedNodeCreator.SandboxedNode createSandbox(ExecutionMonitor exec)
                                                 throws InvalidSettingsException,
                                                        IOException,
                                                        CanceledExecutionException,
                                                        LockFailedException
        Creates that temporary mini workflow that is executed remotely on the cluster/stream executor. The returned value should be SandboxedNodeCreator.SandboxedNode.close() when done (using try-with-resources). After this method is called no other set-method should be called.
        Parameters:
        exec - for progress/cancelation
        Returns:
        the index of the node that represents this node (the node to execute) in the temporary mini workflow
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException
        IOException
        CanceledExecutionException
        LockFailedException

      • copyExistingTablesIntoSandboxContainer

        public static void copyExistingTablesIntoSandboxContainer(NodeContainerExecutionResult execResult,
                                                          NodeContainer sourceNC,
                                                          NodeContainer targetNC,
                                                          ExecutionMonitor progressMon,
                                                          boolean copyDataIntoNewContext)
                                                   throws CanceledExecutionException,
                                                          IOException
        Copies the tables (port and internal) into the context of the corresponding node in the targetWFM. The execution result must fit to the passed node container.
        Parameters:
        execResult - the object holding the result of the sourceNC. If the sourceNC is a workflow, this must hold all results of all contained nodes.
        sourceNC - the node that produced the execution result.
        targetNC - the context into which the tables are copied into
        progressMon - For progress information
        copyDataIntoNewContext - as per setCopyData(boolean)
        Throws:
        CanceledExecutionException
        IOException
